page.title: 08SOCIAL SURVEY : JARROW
page.content: In our survey of the Monkton village, we discovered{75%}of families went to Jarrow shopping centre to do their weekly grocery shopping. Other centres used were Washington, South Shields, Hebburn and Gateshead. General{shopping}was done in Newcastle by 75% of those questioned.{40%}did not use the Monkton shops at all. Of those who did{41%}used the general dealers and 40% the newsagents. Only 25% of the families had ever visited the Bede Art Gallery where the local history exhibition had been most popular. Most of the children in the school have been born on Tyneside with only 3.6% elsewhere in Britain and none overseas. Of a sample of 412 grandparents only 8.9% were not local, indicating a very static population.
